AA.name: AZELAIC ACID
AA.pros: Kills acne bacteria, reduces inflammation, can lightly improve pigmentation problems
AA.cons: Potential side effects include itichiness and irritation

AHA.name: ALPHA HYDROXY ACIDS (AHAS)
AHA.pros: excellet exfoliant, accelerates natural skin cell-turnover process, reduces wrinkles
AHA.cons: can cause irritation from sun exposure, can worsen melasma or other pigmentation problems

Alcohol.name: ALCOHOL
Alcohol.pros: dissolves excessive oil, minimizes pores, dries out active spots
Alcohol.cons: can be over-drying and too aggressive on sensitive skin, ages skin faster

BHA.name: BETA HYDROXY ACID (BHA)
BHA.pros: Great exfoliant, penetrates deeply into pores, less irritation than AHAs
BHA.cons: May increase skin sensitivity to sun exposure

BP.name: BENZOYL PEROXIDE
BP.cons: Dries and peels the skin, can cause allergic reaction

Retinol.name: RETINOL (or Retinoids)
Retinol.pros: Increases collagen production, fades dark spots from sun damage, tretinoin can treat acne
Retinol.cons: cannot be used during day time, makes skin extremely sensitive to sun exposure, can cause peeling

SA.name: SALICYLIC ACID
SA.pros: Removes excessive oil and dead skin cells, great exfoliant
SA.cons: Does not work very well on cystic acne, cannot be used on really dry skin or during pregnancy
